reviews.positive_text: The room was rather small for a family of 3 but the decor was really nice with a modern look, amenities and style. Staff were quite nice, bi-lingual and pleasant. The room itself was quite clean and recently re decorated. The fixings and complimentary soaps and gels in the bathroom were of a high standard. Mini fridge and in room coffee & tea facitites were of a high standard. The hotel interior itself was pleasant and clean.
reviews.negative_text: For us personally the mattresse was on the soft side and the pillows were way to soft. The ridiculous set of bathroom swing doors were totally out of character for the modern style room and a hindrance to enter the bathroom due to the close proximity of the bed.  A fitted sliding door recessed into the wall would have been a better design option and more practical. The bathroom mirror was badly patina and unsightly. The worse part was the hotel frontage influencing  our first impressions. The aluminium siding and mirrored windows were in shocking state and needed a thorough water blasting and clean. The hotel blue coulour had faded badly and patina was very evident. One single lift for accessing the upper floors was quite strange and a constant wait. Thankfully the lift was quite quick.

reviews.positive_text: LOCATION , 10 mins walk into La Rochelle, BUT away from noise and bustle for when you have finished in Town.Good standard of Hotel,not bad parking, if like always you get there early enough.Friendly and helpful staff.All good here.

We stayed for an overnight trip, and the check-in process was straightforward. However, as French learners, we found the receptionist spoke a bit too quickly, which made it difficult for us to understand. She seemed slightly annoyed by our confusion, which was a bit off-putting.

The location was great‚Äîjust a short walk to the park that leads to the marina and a variety of restaurants. We also took a scenic drive to explore some nearby beaches, which gave us a nice feel for the area.

In the evening, feeling tired, we decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant. We enjoyed a lovely bottle of Chablis followed by a delicious steak served with smashed potatoes. The portion was on the smaller side, and we felt it could have been complemented by a salad or some vegetables, but the steak itself was excellent.

Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.positive_text:
The location is excellent. Only a short five minute walk through the lovely city park to the heart of the city and all the beautiful streets lined with restaurants, caf√©s and shops.

The secure car parking was excellent and accommodated our car with it's roof box (2.3m).

The reception and lounge area are comfortable and welcoming although It might be a little too small if the hotel is very busy...the hotel wasn't particularly busy when we stayed in early July. There is a kid's play room and a fussball table and free arcade machine which kept my kids entertained. The pool was clean and although I didn't use it, my daughter had a great time. There wasn't any lifeguard on duty during our stay but the pool is surrounded by safety glass and was challenging for even an adult to get into the pool area so I wouldn't be worried.

The bedrooms were clean and acceptable but nothing special.

The air-conditioning was a concern for me when I read other people's reviews. For your information, the air conditioning (for environmental but also probably for cost control) is set and controlled by the hotel. This means that when you turn on the air conditioning, the temperature is fixed at 23 degrees Celsius in summer and 18 degrees in winter...no adjustment possible by the bedroom user but perhaps reception can override these settings?...we didn't ask. We were dubious about these settings and thought it would be too warm at night in summer to support a good nights sleep but actually it was fine and as a person who prefers a colder room at night, it didn't bother me and I could detect cold air coming into the room during the evening and night, PROVIDED the ≈µindows were kept closed. I suspect that the air conditioning turns off automatically if you open the windows, so my advice is to keep the windows closed in summer, close the blinds during the day, and it will work fine.

The breakfast is very, very good!
reviews.negative_text:
The hotel has a lot going for it but it is a little tired looking in places and hence my reduced score of 7/10. What was once a sparkling glass fronted hotel is now a little tarnished looking, and the hallways and carpets could probably do with refurbishment....but it was still acceptable if you are happy to look past this. 
We arrived the first evening at 7 p.m. we stepped out of the lift on the top floor (5th floor) to the sight of a couple of breakfast trays pilled up on the floor that had not been collected by housekeeping/porter staff and appeared to have been there for some time.....it didn't give an initial good impression but in fairness to the receptionist, when I told her later, they were removed.
The windows in the hotel have no safety catches and can be opened fully...so be particularly careful if staying with young toddlers/children on higher floors...it is a recipe for tragedy, and I would urge management to address this. 
Unfortunately, there are no interconnected rooms in the hotel, but we were given rooms side by side, so that was acceptable for a us (family of 5 staying in two superior doubles with extra sofa beds). 
The bedrooms were a little unusual in so far as the toilet was not in the same area as the bath/shower and sink. Since there is no sink "in" the toilet area, you have to wash your hands in the "bathroom". It's not a complete disaster, I know, but I just  can't understand the logic?

reviews.positive_text: The hotel was a welcome change from the IBIS hotels we had stayed at on this trip. It was more expensive but it was worth it. The room was comfy and extra pillows were so welcome after 2 weeks of single pillows. Fold out couch bed for kids was very comfy. Nice linen and towels and the rituals shower gel etc were lovely (but watered down and the shower gel was empty). The restaurant was nice but too expensive. The wine was ‚Ç¨10 per glass which in france is far too much.  Massive thank you to the staff who helped us when we left our passports in the safe.  Especially William who helped us find a solution.
